meanings.definition: Repousses (noun): Metalwork technique in which a design is hammered into the reverse side of a metal object.
meanings.sent1: The artist used repousses to create intricate patterns on the silver bowl.
meanings.sent2: The repousses on the shield added a beautiful floral motif.
meanings.sent3: The repousses on the teapot made it look like it was wearing a fancy metal dress.
meanings.sent4: Her talent in repousses turned the plain metal sheet into a masterpiece of art.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering repousses caught the light, dazzling all who beheld them.

meanings.definition: Repousses (verb): To create a design on metal by hammering from the reverse side.
meanings.sent1: The skilled artisan repousses the intricate pattern onto the copper plate.
meanings.sent2: She repousses the silver sheet to form delicate swirls and curves.
meanings.sent3: As a hobby, he likes to repousses old coins into unique keychains.
meanings.sent4: The blacksmith's hammer repousses the metal, transforming it into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: With each strike, she repousses the metal, bringing the design to life.
